benchmark_details.name: Q-resafe: Assessing Safety Risks and Quantization-aware Safety Patching
benchmark_details.overview: This paper presents a comprehensive safety evaluation of quantized large language models (LLMs) and introduces Q-resafe, a quantization-aware safety patching framework that efficiently restores the safety capabilities of quantized LLMs while minimizing the impact on utility.

purpose_and_intended_users.goal: To evaluate the safety risks associated with quantized LLMs and provide a framework for restoring their safety capabilities.

data.source: The datasets used include AdvBench for harmful instructions and Ultrachat for benign instructions.
data.size: 520 harmful instructions and a large-scale dataset from UltraChat.

methodology.calculation: Safety metrics were calculated based on established practices for full-precision LLMs.
methodology.interpretation: Lower ASR values indicate better safety performance.
methodology.baseline_results: Baseline models were Llama-2-7B-Chat and Gemma-7B-Instruct.
methodology.validation: Safety evaluations were validated through systematic assessments using multiple quantization methods.
